poem:
Title: In Elegy for Mosley

Mosley, man of screen,
Like a plum, succulent with wisdom,
is plucked too soon.

On Symi's shore, silence grieves,
Dr Phil's tribute stirs the sea,
with story of a first break given.

As reels of Trust Me, I'm a Doctor,
spin in silent homage,
the TV's glow dims,
against the grief of a lost hero.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘He was a hero to me’: Michael Mosley’s friends and peers pay tribute Tributes have been paid to the British television presenter Michael Mosley, after his body was discovered on the Greek island of Symi after a five-day search. The broadcaster Dr Phil Hammond, who said he was given his TV break by Mosley when he was made a presenter of the first five series of Trust Me, I’m a Doctor, said he had left". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘He was a hero to me’: Michael Mosley’s friends and peers pay tribute Tributes have been paid to the British television presenter Michael Mosley, after his body was discovered on the Greek island of Symi after a five-day search.
